title: Parameterized Analysis of Bribery in Challenge the Champ Tournaments
abstract: arXiv:2403.17587v1 Announce Type: cross  Abstract: Challenge the champ tournaments are one of the simplest forms of competition, where a (initially selected) champ is repeatedly challenged by other players. If a player beats the champ, then that player is considered the new (current) champ. Each player in the competition challenges the current champ once in a fixed order. The champ of the last round is considered the winner of the tournament. We investigate a setting where players can be bribed to lower their winning probability against the initial champ. The goal is to maximize the probability of the initial champ winning the tournament by bribing the other players, while not exceeding a given budget for the bribes. Mattei et al. [Journal of Applied Logic, 2015] showed that the problem can be solved in pseudo-polynomial time, and that it is in XP when parameterized by the number of players. translated_title: 在“挑战冠军”比赛中贿赂的参数化分析
translated_abstract: 挑战冠军比赛是最简单的竞争形式之一，其中一个（最初选择的）冠军反复受到其他玩家的挑战。如果玩家击败冠军，则该玩家被视为新的（当前的）冠军。每位参赛选手按照固定顺序挑战当前的冠军一次。最后一轮的冠军被视为比赛的获胜者。我们研究了一种情形，即玩家可以被贿赂以降低他们对最初冠军的获胜概率。目标是通过贿赂其他玩家来最大化最初冠军赢得比赛的概率，并且不超过规定的贿赂预算。Mattei等人[《应用逻辑杂志》，2015年]表明该问题可以在伪多项式时间内解决，并且在以玩家数量作为参数的情况下，该问题属于XP。我们表明，当以玩家数量为参数时，该问题是弱NP困难的，并且是W[1]-hard的。
tldr: 研究了在“挑战冠军”比赛中贿赂的参数化分析问题，探讨通过贿赂其他玩家来增加最初冠军赢得比赛的概率，并在限定预算下进行优化。研究发现在以玩家数量为参数时，这一问题是弱NP困难且W[1]-hard的。
en_tdlr: Investigated the parameterized analysis of bribery in "Challenge the Champ" tournaments, exploring the optimization of increasing the initial champ's winning probability by bribing other players within a given budget. The study revealed the problem to be weakly NP-hard and W[1]-hard when parameterized by the number of players.
